seo.title: About SustainSage | Bilingual coaching grounded in ethics
seo.description: Meet the bilingual coaches behind SustainSage, the transitions we support, and the boundaries that keep every partnership safe.

intro.title: Coaching for complex transitions
intro.body: SustainSage is led by bilingual coaches who have moved between Taiwan, Singapore, and the UK. We keep coaching steady, culturally aware, and grounded in practical experiments.

approach.title: Experiments that respect pace and context
approach.description: Every partnership begins with informed consent, shared language, and clarity on how we will work together.

pillars.title: Context before action
pillars.description: We map systems, constraints, and access needs before suggesting experiments.

pillars.title: Bilingual collaboration
pillars.description: Sessions move between English, Traditional Chinese, and Simplified Chinese so nuance survives translation.

pillars.title: Reflective practice
pillars.description: Monthly supervision and pause points keep bias, risk, and wellbeing in view.

cases: Graduate → clearer story, 2 callbacks within one cycle.
Returner → 3-month ramp plan, part-time to full-time.
Switcher → portfolio reframing, first project in 6 weeks.

Founder aligning a cross-border team
cases.context: Series A founder scaling operations between Taipei and London with clashing expectations.
cases.coaching_moves: Co-created bilingual agreements, clarified decision rights, rehearsed feedback in both languages.
cases.shift: Meetings regained focus, with teammates reporting clearer ownership and calmer escalation paths.
cases.disclaimer: Details blended from multiple engagements to protect confidentiality.

cases.title: Climate partnership renegotiating scope
cases.context: NGO and investor partnership needed to reset expectations after leadership changes.
cases.coaching_moves: Surfaced assumptions, rehearsed boundary language, and prototyped a revised shared roadmap.
cases.shift: Both parties recommitted with defined data-sharing cadence and clearer escalation checkpoints.
cases.disclaimer: Composite scenario respecting privacy of all clients.

cases.title: Policy lead rebuilding stamina
cases.context: Public policy advisor juggling multilingual briefs and caregiver duties.
cases.coaching_moves: Mapped energy audits, simplified reporting rituals, and negotiated realistic stakeholder updates.
cases.shift: Client reported steadier workload and regained confidence presenting in both Mandarin and English.
cases.disclaimer: Case anonymised and blended to remove identifying details.

key_points.title: What guides our coaching
items: ICF-aligned practice keeps agreements, data care, and supervision transparent.
Lived experience across Asia-Pacific and the UK keeps culture and policy context in view.
No-drama experiments help you build momentum without burning out.

process.title: How partnerships unfold
process.description: Every engagement starts with context, informed consent, and clarity on how we will work together.

steps.title: Set shared agreements
steps.description: We confirm goals, roles, confidentiality boundaries, cadence, and data retention before sessions begin.

steps.title: Work bilingually
steps.description: Coaching flows between English, Traditional Chinese, and Simplified Chinese so nuance stays intact.

steps.title: Reflect and adapt
steps.description: Monthly supervision and reflective practice help us surface blind spots and adjust support early.

whatIsCoaching.title: What coaching looks like with SustainSage
whatIsCoaching.description: Coaching is a structured, future-focused partnership where you stay in charge of direction and pace.
scenarios: You’re returning to work after a break and want a kinder ramp back.
You’ve applied widely but struggle to turn interviews into offers.
You got an offer but aren’t sure it fits your real priorities.
You’re switching fields and feel you’re starting from zero.
You’re in the UK with overseas experience and need local proof points.
You lead a small team and want steadier 1:1 conversations.

Launching a role across cultures
scenarios.description: Clarify decision rights, agreements, and handoffs before expectations fracture.

scenarios.title: Needing accountability for experiments
scenarios.description: Design lightweight trials, data care plans, and check-ins that keep momentum without burnout.

scenarios.title: Untangling stakeholder dynamics
scenarios.description: Surface power dynamics, accessibility needs, and language you can safely bring back to the room.

whatIsCoaching.disclaimer: Coaching does not replace therapy, legal advice, or crisis response. We will pause and refer when specialised care is required.

ethics.title: ICF-aligned boundaries that protect your data
ethics.summary: We anchor every engagement in the International Coaching Federation (ICF) Code of Ethics and document how data is cared for from day one.
principles: Set informed consent, confidentiality boundaries, and escalation paths before sessions begin.
Check accessibility, safeguarding, and wellbeing every few sessions to adjust support early.
Pause or refer when therapeutic, legal, or crisis support is more appropriate than coaching.

dataPractices.title: How we handle your data
items: Store session notes in encrypted, access-controlled systems with time-bound retention.
Share summaries only with people named in the original agreement, never external parties without consent.
Delete recordings or artefacts immediately when they are no longer required for the coaching goal.

ethics.icfReference: Review the ICF Code of Ethics to see the standards we commit to in every partnership.

boundaries.title: Boundaries we uphold
boundaries.description: These commitments protect your agency, safety, and consent.

items.question: What scope does coaching cover?
items.answer: We stay future-focused and collaborative. When therapeutic or legal support is needed, we pause and signpost trusted professionals.

items.question: How do you monitor ethics?
items.answer: We follow the International Coaching Federation Code of Ethics and maintain supervision to stay accountable.

items.question: What if accessibility needs change?
items.answer: We revisit agreements every few sessions to check progress, accessibility, and safeguarding requirements.

callout.title: Ready to map your next step?
callout.body: Browse our coaching services or read the full coaching boundaries we uphold.
